intro: Lophotocarpus guayanensis var. madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar lophotocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features include woody stems and capsule fruits that release seeds through dehiscence. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
